Posts.Content: Just curious how everyone was first diagnosed? Was it through mammo, ultrasound, etc? Did you find a lump yourself, with or without pain? Thanks!
Posts.Title: How was your BC diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Thank you for your kind words. They are much appreciated. I am currently waiting for the breast clinic to get back to me regarding a biopsy appointment. I will keep you posted.
Posts.Title: How was your BC diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Hi there, well, I AM curious how women were first diagnosed, mainly because I am going through a scare myself. I have dense breasts, had a clear 3D mammogram 2 months ago, but I have recently discovered a painful lump/thickened area in the upper outer quadrant of my left breast. The pain does not dissipate after my menstrual cycle. I had an ultrasound today and the radiologist felt it necessary for me to have an ultrasound guided biopsy of the area. I am guessing that if he felt it was a cyst, he wouldn't insist on a biopsy. I am 46 years old, no family history, no risk factors at all, but I guess that doesn't necessarily mean anything. I am hoping and praying it is just a clump of normal fibrous tissue.
Posts.Title: How was your BC diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Hi there, I am also 46 and having the same issue, except its on my upper outer left breast. I had a 3D mammogram 6 weeks ago which I was told was normal, although according to the report, I have dense breasts. I do feel a thickening in the painful area. I went to my GYN yesterday and she felt it might just be inflamed due to hormonal flux. She said if it doesnt improve after my next period has come and gone, shell send me for an ultrasound.
Posts.Title: Is this fibrocystic breast pain?

Posts.Content: Hi all, I'm wondering if I could go 2 years between mammograms as opposed to annually. I'm 41, no family history, am very fit, eat a vegetarian diet with no alcohol and very little sugar. I do a self exam monthly as well as receiving a clinical breast exam by my GYN yearly. I hate the thought radiating my breasts every year if I could go without and go every 2 years instead. I have been told I have dense breasts. Thoughts?
Posts.Title: Annual mammograms necessary?
